transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Say, what was that noise last night?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, that was my hive. It exploded.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I was microwavin' this big freakin'...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: My horse?!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Better not be!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: So... can I sleep on your couch?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sure you can! We'll be roomies! (spraying sound in background) I've got a case of Bosco and some milk, we'll make cheese dogs. Hey, I just picked up the Godfather trilogy. Finally, company! Alri-  (sniffs)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oh!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What's that stench?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm markin' my territory! Get used to it!

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: Hello everybody, la de da! This is Tansut, tonight...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Tansut, you're fired.

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: Oh, really?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Have your locker cleaned out by five.

transcript.speaker: Tansut
transcript.dialogue: (quavering voice) I won't cry. If you're wanting to see me cry, you can save your breath, because I'm not going to cry. (starts crying) Oh, what will become of me? (cries some more)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) (stares at Zorak)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What?!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You know what, mister. I found my toothbrush marinating in the toilet this morning.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I rinsed it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm not runnin' a flophouse for degenerate bugs.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Never judge a bug by its shell.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What you see is what you get.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Act in haste, repent in leisure.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: He who hesitates is lost.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Help me, Obi-wan, you're my only hope.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: A little song, a little dance, a little seltzer down your pants.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ih... I don't know...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What did I say, now, wait a minute...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (looking at a book) Uhhh, sorry, Space Ghost, no good.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Ka-ching! I am the quote-master!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm the quotemaster!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I am!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I am!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Eggs and ham!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Waffle!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (as Space Ghost and Zorak argue in the background) Stand by, McKean, roommate quarrel.

transcript.speaker: Michael McKean
transcript.dialogue: Oh, okay.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I had a roommate once. Until I boiled him in his own juices. It's a side of me nobody understands.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Grits!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bacon and grits!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Cheese toast!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Fortified milk!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Donkey Kong!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Nope, I win.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (looking at book again) Wait a minute...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Overruled. I am the undisputed breakfast-master. Okay! So let's welcome Michael McKean, because he's my first guest.

transcript.speaker: Michael McKean
transcript.dialogue: (monitor lowers from ceiling) Thank you, Space Ghost, this is a great honor.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Blather on about yourself.

transcript.speaker: Michael McKean
transcript.dialogue: Oh, my name is Michael McKean, I, I'm an Earth actor, um, specifically a United States Earth actor, and more specifically, uh, I'm in the Comedy Ghetto.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (to Zorak) Which is about where you're headed, Banjo Brown.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (stares back silently)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (quietly) I don't even know what that means. Do you, Michael?

transcript.speaker: Michael McKean
transcript.dialogue: No, it's, it's just wonderful to be here, I've never...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's nice. Do you know that living with Zorak is like living in a living nightmare?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Paint my toenails! Get me a milk and Pepsi! Fetch my ointment!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Living with you is like living in a living nightmare!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: See that?

transcript.speaker: Michael McKean
transcript.dialogue: (looks back silently)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: McKean?

transcript.speaker: Michael McKean
transcript.dialogue: (sticks tongue out at Zorak)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, what are you doin'?

transcript.speaker: Michael McKean
transcript.dialogue: You'll have to excuse me, I'm feeling waves of pure evil coming from Zarak, is that me?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: "Zarak"?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Eh, hold on. Is it Zorak or Zerak or Zorak? Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (looking through a book again) Uhhh..... yeah. Sure.

transcript.speaker: Michael McKean
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Thank you, Moltar. (monitor shows McKean and text:)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost, look! (dramatic sting music)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Aaaah!

transcript.speaker: Michael McKean
transcript.dialogue: Ooooh! (bites his palm)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Nothin'. I just wanted you to look at me.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Just ignore him. Zorak was just born for fun, loyal to none.

transcript.speaker: Michael McKean
transcript.dialogue: He doesn't look happy.

transcript.speaker: Michael McKean
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, see what I mean?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Tell me about it!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Have you seen my BooBooKitty?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I saw her when I let her out.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You let her out?! When?!?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Um... yesterday. Now fix me a sandwich! I'm drying my skull.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Living with you is like living in a living nightmare!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: And do my other foot!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Where is she?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You'll never know! (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Who knows where my BooBooKitty is? Do you know, McKean?

transcript.speaker: Michael McKean
transcript.dialogue: I'd go right to the girl's locker room.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey! (monitor shows text:)

transcript.speaker: Michael McKean
transcript.dialogue: Did I let something slip?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (perturbed) Great! Thanks a lot, McKean!

transcript.speaker: Michael McKean
transcript.dialogue: Oh boy! (puts hand over his mouth) Me and my big mouth!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So! BooBooKitty's in the girl's locker room, huh?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah. Go get it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (looks at Zorak) I'm coming, BooBooKitty! (flies off)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Good one, McKean!

transcript.speaker: Michael McKean
transcript.dialogue: Thank you.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Yeah!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (bounds back to desk) We don't have girls up here! Where's my BooBooKitty, you villainous headborne claphole?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughing) She's gone! Gone for good!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But why? I gave her everything she ever needed.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Everything but love! She hated you! And that's why I set her free.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Nooooooooooooooooo!!! (distraught, puts hand over face) BooBoo! BooBooKitty! I didn't love you enough! I must now lash out at everyone around me! Feel my anger! (blasts Zorak with powerbands) (blasts Moltar) (blasts Michael) (blasts Zorak again) (blasts Moltar again) (blasts Zorak again)

transcript.speaker: David Lander
transcript.dialogue: (appears on monitor, talks in Squiggy voice) Hello, I just wanna say that I really like being here, out in the outer... in outer space areas of this place. And, uh, it's like, it's like so, it's so real it's like bein' in a movie.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stares back silently)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (stares back silently)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (lies on his back silently)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (still laughing)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (still laughing)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (still laughing)

transcript.speaker: David Lander
transcript.dialogue: (still in Squiggy voice) I feel like everything here is trick photograpy

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, that sounds like, uh, like that guy, that guy, with the show, the show where, where the guy talked like, it's...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Like, um, that guy, from, uh, it's... it's Balki, from TV's "Perfect Strangers".

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No, it's not, it's Angie Dickinson. You know, Pepper, TV's "Police Woman". (monitor shows text:)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Boy, Angie, you've really let yourself go. (Wait a minute! Angie Dickinson was a statuesque blonde!) Who are you!?

transcript.speaker: David Lander
transcript.dialogue: Hello, I'm Freddy Herbie. You know me, "I thought they was prunes!"

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: They weren't prunes? What the heck were they? (pause) And now I'm having a new thought. One. One is the loneliest number that you'll ever do. (sings quietly) BooBoo, you're a fine cat, what a good wife you would be. Ohhh!! (puts hand over face)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, you're outta toilet paper!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, Zorak, that reminds me, you're no longer my new roommate.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That's fine. You're outta Tang anyway. (sprays again)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ugghh!

transcript.speaker: David Lander
transcript.dialogue: Ooof, goodness! Tacos, huh?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Space Ghost! Your beef logs are here. (monitor shows text:)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Just stack them on the dock, Moltar. Lincoln log style, like I showed ya.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (sighs) Let me get my lumbar harness. (walks off)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I love beef logs, don't you?

transcript.speaker: David Lander
transcript.dialogue: Oh boy, do I. I'll tell ya, I really do.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Didja ever weigh yourself, then eat a whole beef log, then weigh yourself again?

transcript.speaker: David Lander
transcript.dialogue: Mmm, oh please, I'm hungry, and you're tellin' me beef log, oh, that's great.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (quietly) BooBooKitty and I used to do that.

transcript.speaker: David Lander
transcript.dialogue: You ever throw one on the fire just to keep warm?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Didja ever make a baby with one? A beef log baby? You ever take 'em and make a little village full of beef log babies, and then they all rise up against you and try to kill your head?

transcript.speaker: David Lander
transcript.dialogue: (long pause) Um, no.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's when I have to lie down. That reminds me of a joke!

transcript.speaker: David Lander
transcript.dialogue: Okay, go ahead and tell me one.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: There's this guy, see, he's from Alabama. And he gets busted for tryin' to smuggle books, into Kentucky!

transcript.speaker: David Lander
transcript.dialogue: (pauses, then nods) That's good, it has some... I guess it loses something in the, the translation, you know.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Did I mention that the guy from Alabama was my mother-in-law? (laughs) Hey, good night, everybody.

transcript.speaker: David Lander
transcript.dialogue: You might wanna, the next time you tell a joke, you might wanna say "And now the joke is over," and then the person can laugh, 'cause I think that's, that helps so much.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I know a guy who had two noses.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: How does he smell?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Awful! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) That's right, he smells awful! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: And now the joke's over. (Moltar keeps laughing)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I like those glasses you have.

transcript.speaker: David Lander
transcript.dialogue: Yeah?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, there's really nothing that I don't like about you. Freddy, will you be my new roommate?

transcript.speaker: David Lander
transcript.dialogue: That's the main reason I'm on the show.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Really? Oh boy! Hey, you wanna put on some pressure suits and go outside and see my interplanetary monument to the safety pin? (dramatic music, BooBooKitty floats by outside the studio window, Space Ghost doesn't notice) I just erected it.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Space Ghost, look out the window.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sees BooBooKitty floating by) Well, BooBooKitty! Come crawlin' back to Daddy, huh?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Isn't she drifting precariously close to your big pin?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (gasps) Noooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: ...ooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo... (takes a breath) Nooooooooooooooooooooo...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I warned Christo, I told him we needed a rubber safety tip! (as BooBooKitty jets by outside the window)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (stares at Space Ghost)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What, you guys saw me, there's nothin' I could have done.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You could have gone out there and saved her.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I mean, it would only have taken a second to move her out of the way.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, it's not like she was heavy or anything.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I think you wanted her to die.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, I guess we'll never know, 'cause now I have a new pet! And he's the best and most favorite pet I've ever had! Billy the porpoise! See you back at the ranch, roomie! It's pizza night! (flies off)

transcript.speaker: David Lander
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, where do you guys go to eat?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Rock 'n Bowl, pizza in a cup. It's good.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yippee ki yi yay! Merrrry Christmas, everybody!

transcript.speaker: Billy
transcript.dialogue: (chirps)

transcript.speaker: David Lander
transcript.dialogue: I feel like everything here is trick photography.
